head.supplied: Industrial Museum ¶ 9th July [18]72 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I am directed by the Committee of the Industrial Museum to inform you that they are willing to purchase the drawings of flowers submitted by you to them ...

div.p: Letter no. 88/I.T.M.72, Outward letterbook 1870-9 p. 467, Industrial and Technological Museum and Public Library, Museum Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #000000;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #000000;

div.p: I am directed by the Committee of the Industrial Museum to inform you that they are willing to purchase the drawings of flowers submitted by you to them through the Hon. J.A. Macpherson for the sum of £1. 1. one guinea each.
I am also requested to ask you to name a price for the other drawings of a similar nature which were submitted by you some time back through the Rev Dr. Bleasdale.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Baron v Mueller
For reply, see M to M. Clarke, 18 July 1872.
